conclusion: Analyze the system step by step to determine the charge on the capacitor and identify which plate is positively charged.
Two metal rods are rotating with angular velocity in a magnetic field.
Calculate EMF generated in each rod using the formula for EMF in a rotating rod in a magnetic field.
EMF generated in each rod is 12 V.
Total EMF generated by two rods is 24 V.
Total resistance in the circuit is the sum of resistances of the two rods.
Calculate current in the circuit using Ohm's law.
Capacitor is connected to the circuit and will charge up to the voltage of the EMF.
Calculate charge on the capacitor using the formula Q = C x Voltage.
Charge on the capacitor is 2.16 C.
Consider the direction of the EMF generated by the rotating rods to determine the polarity of the capacitor.
Using the right-hand rule, determine the direction of the induced current in the rods.
Assuming rods rotate counterclockwise, the plate M will be positively charged.
Final answer: Charge on the capacitor is 2.16 C, and plate M is positively charged.
